instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2179: What is A2179? A2179 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2020 with EMC 3302, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01958..
definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - No Audio
threads.message:
Came in for liquid damage on Right I/O experiencing no Audio at all; 
Mic is working, output is shown in system settings, audio jack working OK. 

Tried known-good Right I/O with good known speakers with good cable and still issue is not resolved
Tried DFU and restore with fresh macOS; still same issue 

Diode mode reading on MLB it's OK (no I/O board was connected atm)
I measured diode readings on bad I/O and found <SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_INT_L</SIGNAL> diode reading is high 0.780 instead of 0.413.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - No Audio
threads.message:
Usually one of T2 lines connected near <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> on the audio flex, gets damaged.
In such case you should find a very low value to ground on that line.
However, higher value than normal may denote a problem too; but not usual to find...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - No Audio
threads.message:
Those voltage readings are with a known-good I/o and known cable whilst computer is awake 

<SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_INT_L</SIGNAL> = 1.8v
<SIGNAL>AUD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> = 1.8v
<SIGNAL>CODEC_WAKE_L</SIGNAL> = 1.78v
<SIGNAL>CODEC_INT_L</SIGNAL> = 1.78v
<SIGNAL>CODEC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 1.8v

<SIGNAL>CODEC_INT_L</SIGNAL> means Codec will initiates when the line is low, correct? but the line is not low.. 

Sadly I don't have a known good <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> to compare readings 

Do I just go ahead and try to replace T2?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - No Audio
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - No Audio
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - No Audio
threads.message: I faced similar issue, but <SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> was shorted to ground (inside T2) in my case.
